alert.note: Alert for Western Siskiyou County (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 06 at 5:50PM PST until January 06 at 7:00PM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM PST THIS EVENING ABOVE 2500 FEET... * WHAT...Snow expected above 2500 feet. Total snow accumulations of 5 to 10 inches. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. * WHERE...Western Siskiyou County in California, the foothills of the Cascades and the high terrain of the Kalmiopsis wilderness in southern Oregon above 2500 feet. This includes Etna, Callahan, Fort Jones, Butte Falls, Prospect, Toketee Falls, and portions of highways 140, 62, and 227. * WHEN...Until 7 PM PST this evening. * IMPACTS...Travel could become very difficult with snow covered roads and reduced visibility. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * Travel is strongly discouraged because of dangerous conditions. Do not detour during winter storms. * If you must travel, keep tire chains, a flashlight, blankets, food, water, medications, and a fully charged phone with you. * The safest place during a winter storm is indoors. * A Winter Storm Warning means that severe winter weather is likely and poses a threat to life and property. Take protective action now.
